channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: I-convergence of sequences in metric-like spaces
item.description: arXiv:2408.13264v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper we introduce and study the notion of I-convergence of sequences in a metric-like space, where I is an ideal of subsets of the set N of all natural numbers. Further introducing the notion of I*-convergence of sequences in a metric-like space we study its relationship with I-convergence.
item.dc:creator: Prasanta Malik, Saikat Das

item.title: Problems on $\beta\mathbb{N}$
item.description: arXiv:2205.11204v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This is an update on, and expansion of, our paper Open problems on $\beta\omega$ in the book Open Problems in Topology.
item.dc:creator: Klaas Pieter Hart, Jan van Mill

item.title: $C$-embedding, Lindel\"ofness, and \v{C}ech-completeness
item.description: arXiv:2404.19703v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that in the class of Lindel\"of \v{C}ech-complete spaces the property of being $C$-embedded is quite well-behaved. It admits a useful characterization that can be used to show that products and perfect preimages of $C$-embedded spaces are again $C$-embedded. We also show that both properties, Lindel\"of and \v{C}ech-complete, are needed in the product result.
item.dc:creator: Alan Dow, Klaas Pieter Hart, Jan van Mill, Hans Vermeer

item.title: Endpoints of smooth plane dendroids
item.description: arXiv:2405.01706v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $X$ be a smooth dendroid in the plane $\mathbb R^2$. We show that each endpoint of $X$ is arcwise accessible from $\mathbb R^2\setminus X$, and that the space of endpoints $E(X)$ has the property of a circle. In the event that $E(X)$ is connected, we call $X$ a *Bellamy dendroid*. We prove that if $E(X)$ is 1-dimensional, then $X$ contains a Bellamy dendroid or a Cantor set of arcs. In particular, if $E(X)$ totally disconnected and 1-dimensional, then $X$ is non-Suslinian. An example is constructed to show that this is false outside the plane.
item.dc:creator: David S. Lipham
